terms.definition: The specific legal system of a jurisdiction that will be applied to interpret and enforce an agreement.
A formal phrase used at the end of a contract, preceding the signatures, signifying that the parties are signing to confirm their agreement.
A self-employed individual or entity hired to perform a specific job or service, retaining control over how the work is done.
Often used in legal documents to introduce the operative or binding part of an agreement after background information.
A word used in legal documents, often following background 'WHEREAS' clauses, to introduce the operative terms or resolutions of an agreement.
A word used at the beginning of recitals in a legal document to introduce background facts or reasons for the agreement.
A person authorized to act on behalf of another party (the principal) in dealings with third parties.
A contractual clause specifying which jurisdiction's laws will apply to resolve any disputes arising from the contract.
Rules within a legal system that determine which jurisdiction's laws should apply when there is a dispute involving multiple legal systems.
Means that the terms of an agreement will be interpreted and understood according to the laws or principles of a specified jurisdiction.
An individual hired to work for another person or company, subject to their control and paid a wage or salary.
Indicates the effective date from which the terms of an agreement are considered to be in force, regardless of the actual signing date.
When a contract or document has been formally signed by all parties, making it legally binding.
An adverb used in legal documents to refer to 'in this document' or 'in this agreement'.
A legal term indicating that something of value is being exchanged or given as the basis for a contract.
A participant in a temporary business arrangement or project with another party, sharing risks, profits, and control.
Refers to the reciprocal agreements and commitments made by all parties involved in a contract.
A co-owner of a business or venture who shares in its profits, losses, and often its management.
The primary location where a company's business activities are managed and directed.
Confidential business information that provides a company with a competitive advantage and is legally protected from unauthorized disclosure.
